Welcome to

XAENOMORPH

Insanity at its peak

PRESENTATION


Howdy fellow traveler, and welcome to my humble abode!

Uhm, so...I have literally no idea how you ended up visiting this website...

Clicking on random links on the Internet isn't the safest thing to do while you try to deal with boredom, right?

As we usually tend to say, curiosity killed the cat.

Therefore, don't be a cat. Really.

Too bad you just clicked on that link anyway, and now you're here, clueless of what is happening.

so, y'know...

Let me introduce myself a little


My name is Angelo.

I'm an Italian guy keen on learning new things everyday.

It would be pretty accurate to describe me as a tech enthusiast, someone interested in the art of software development and other bullshit like that.

Needless to say that I'm pretty much a filthy newb, but I try to improve day after day.

My experience in this sector revolves mainly around C and Py practice sessions, other than aimless attempts at coding random static HTML pages.

This very website is a semi-failed experiment of design and web developing as a whole! Yay!

I've recently converted it to Jekyll in order to manage posts and the blog page itself in a "comfortable" way.


While chasing the feeble and vain hope of basing my future job on this stuff I do as a mere hobby, I cultivate several other passions,

ranging from reading (mainly sci-fi/cyberpunk novels and mythology books), writing and working out,

to cinematography (my favorite directors being Lynch, Von Trier, Polanski, P.T. Anderson and Bergman),

music (basically obsessed with Crystal Castles, Radiohead, Slowdive and Aphex Twin), videogames and even art.

It may sound cringy and cocky, but I consider myself to be an aesthete,

a cultist of beauty, constantly bewitched by visually pleasing things surrounding me,

while being driven mostly by admiration but also envy towards those very things.


This site is nothing more than a collection of ramblings and thoughts.

something that keeps slowly evolving with time.

something that I want to make my unique, comfy little place.



You're free to explore, but keep in mind that some pages may still not be fully functional.

That said, see you around.
